item.title: Pi-Hole
item.description: Pi-Hole serves as a local DNS server. In particular, it acts as a DNS sinkhole to provide network-level ad and tracker blocking. It works by intercepting DNS requests from all devices on the network and blocking requests to known advertising and tracking domains, effectively stopping ads before they’re even downloaded.

item.title: Homelab Services
item.description: Current list of services hosted Hosted on Docker unless specified. Pi-Hole (x2, once on Bare) Wireguard (server and client) DNSMasq (for Wireguard server) Cloudflared ddclient Jellyfin Mailrise MongoDB Transmission Diun Uptime-Kuma Nginx Proxy Manager (NPM) including web server Portainer Syncthing (on TrueNAS) fail2ban (on Bare) Programmable config name, host, proxy, protocol router, 192.168.1.1, http://router:80, - pihole1, 192.168.1.98, http://pihole1:80, - proxmox, 192.168.1.99, https://proxmox:8006, WS truenas, 192.168.1.100, http://truenas:80, WS dockerhost, 192.168.1.101, - jellyfin, dockerhost, http://ct-jellyfin:8096, WS npm, dockerhost, http://ct-npm:81, - pihole2, dockerhost, http://ct-pihole:80, - portainer, dockerhost, https://ct-portainer:9443, - syncthing, dockerhost, https://truenas:20910, - transmission, dockerhost, http://ct-wireguard-client:9091, - uptime-kuma, dockerhost, http://ct-uptime-kuma:3001, - wireguard-easy, dockerhost, http://wireguard-easy:51821, - mailrise, dockerhost, stream://ct-mailrise:8025, TCP mongodb, dockerhost, stream://ct-mongodb:27017, TCP wireguard-easy, dockerhost, stream://wireguard-easy:51820, UDP cloudflared, dockerhost, -, - ddclient, dockerhost, -, - diun, dockerhost, -, - dnsmasq-wireguard, dockerhost, -, - wireguard-client, dockerhost, -, - one137, dockerhost, http://STATIC_FILES:1, - See Services and network layout (not public).

item.title: Nginx Proxy Manager (NPM)
item.description: Simple reverse proxy to expose services with Proxy and stream hosts A beginner-friendly UI Let’s Encrypt certs generation and auto-renewal Access lists UI-toggleable options ...

item.title: Public Website
item.description: The website is accessible at one137.dev. It consists of a cute animation as the homepage, and a sort of Wiki at one137.dev/knowledge. The Wiki is based on Obsidian and Quartz and its creation process is detailed here.

item.title: Cloudflared
item.description: Command-line daemon that creates secure tunnels between local services and Cloudflare’s edge network, allowing to expose local applications to the internet without opening inbound ...

item.title: Continuous Delivery
item.description: The goal is to implement the ubiquitous “push to deploy” – a simple continuous delivery mechanism that automatically redeploys a git repo when a commit is pushed to its master branch ...

item.title: Comments API
item.description: Custom solution that provides a comments section to every page of the Wiki. The frontend is generated by a script which is included at the bottom of every Quartz page.

item.title: Obsidian Vault to Wiki
item.description: A section of my website, the one you are one right now reading these lines, is a sort of wiki. The wiki’s content, aka the text pages or “notes”, are created using the awesome Obsidian app.

item.title: Remote Graphical OS Access
item.description: XRDP provides better performance than VNC and is easier to set up. It runs on port 3389 by default. sudo apt update && sudo apt install xrdp sudo systemctl enable xrdp sudo systemctl start xrdp From a Mac, Microsoft Remote Desktop (available free from the Mac App Store) is good to access XRDP servers.

item.title: Kali Linux
item.description: Quid Debian fork focused on security, penetration testing in particular. It comes pre-installed with lots of tools for security testing. Great to learn about security and networking and testing the homelab from within.
